definition: to settle a matter in one go
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: We'd better settle the matter at one go.
sentences.chinese: 解决这个问题我们最好一步到位。
操作简便，安装一步到位。

sentences.english: If pursues one-sidedly reaches one 's goal instantly, possibly will have created the high debt.
sentences.chinese: 如果片面追求一步到位，可能会造成过高的负债。

sentences.english: The problem must be solved once for all, without leaving any loose ends.
sentences.chinese: 解决这个问题一定要做到一步到位，不留尾巴。

definition: to get sth done once and for all
(idiom) take care of everything; handle everything
one-off (offer)/one-time/single-use/disposable (goods)
to omit/to dispense with/to make unnecesary/to save (time, trouble etc)
to cause no trouble/to be spared worry/worry-free
lit. to want to get fat with only one mouthful (proverb)/fig. to try to achieve one's goal in the shortest time possible/to be impatient for success
pinyin: yi1 kou3 chi1 ge5 pang4 zi5

definition: to fix/to settle/to wangle
simplification/to simplify
to save money
What you see is what you get (WYSIWYG)
to handle administrative work
to simplify matters/to save trouble
many and complicated/mired in minor details
lit. set up a pole and see the shadow (idiom); fig. instant effect/quick results
plan/program (for action etc)/proposal/proposed bill/CL:個|个[ge4],套[tao4]
high-end

lit. the fish and the bear's paw, you can't have both at the same time (idiom, from Mencius); fig. you must choose one or the other/you can't always get everything you want/you can't have your cake and eat it
